title: How you can fix most broken boilers in freezing weather
text: When the mercury drops and we're faced with freezing temperatures outside, the last thing any of us want is for our heating to fail. But for many of us, there's a quick fix we can all try out before calling out an emergency plumber. And a considerate plumber has shared the advice which could sort many people's broken boilers this winter as the UK shivers its way into spring, report the [Derby Telegraph](https://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/). Martin Broer has been telling customers they may not need a call-out if they try his money-saving advice. The Derby plumber, who runs M Broer Heating, said all you need is a kettle to fix a very common problem. He said: "We've had a lot of customers calling up with frozen condensate pipes and boilers cutting out. READ MORE: [Adorable pooches at Dogs Trust Loughborough looking for homes](https://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/news/local-news/adorable-pooches-dogs-trust-loughborough-9001523) "There's always a plastic pipe on the outside of the house and it runs down to the drain. Now, because there's such a small amount, it can get frozen up inside. "What you do is boil your trusty kettle and just pour it all over the pipe. Once you've done that it should defrost. Go inside, reset your boiler, and everyone's happy!" Mr Broer shared a video of the advice on his company's Facebook page and many of his customers thanked him for the trick.
